description:
I thought for sure Democrats were going to find a way to politicize college basketball phenom Caitlyn Clark. The same way they do Beyonce's country album and Taylor Swift doing much of anything. Way too many Americans are unified watching Clark cook on the court for Democrats to NOT try and drag her into their agenda. They haven't yet, but Kamala Harris is still attempting to politicize the NCAA tournament with these derptastic bars: claiming women didn't have their own bracket until 2022.

Let that one simmer for a bit.
title: Kamala Harris clowns herself with shameless pander on when women were allowed NCAA "brackets." Also, she's dead wrong.

description:
"Mr. Wonderful" Kevin O'Leary has been on fire lately, and social media influencer Rep. AOC is always good for a few yuks. O'Leary actually praised her for the skilled way she posts things on Twitter and talking into her phone. The rub is when we get to her side hustle as a member of Congress. That's where the "Shark Tank" star thinks she sucks at life.

Not the first time O'Leary has let Rep. AOC's name come out of his mouth. The successful businessman was impressed by the way she was able to support her socialism by buying a $60 "Eat the Rich" sweatshirt. "I'm going to guess she lands this for six bucks. And five bucks for shipping. That's EIGHTY-FIVE PERCENT gross margin!" Get it how you live.

Rep. AOC is great at helping her
title: 'Shark Tank' star reignites feud with AOC: "I wouldn't let her manage a candy store"

If an album stands on its own, you don't need to ask Kamala Harris and Michelle Obama to tweet about how amazing and transcending your pop songs are. And then there is The View's Joy Behar, who uses the incident as an excuse to fire shots at Dolly Parton.

title: Shrill harpy Joy Behar lashes out at Dolly Parton's "Jolene" because, unlike Beyonce, Dolly is "anti-feminist"
